title: Alexander Andreevich Samarskii
summary: Alexander Andreevich Samarskii (Александр Андреевич Самарский, 19 February 1919, Amvrosiivka, metropolitan Donetsk, Yekaterinoslav Governorate – 11 February 2008, Moscow) was a Soviet and Russian mathematician and academician (USSR Academy of Sciences, Russian Academy of Sciences), specializing in mathematical physics, applied mathematics, numerical analysis, mathematical modeling, finite difference methods.[1]
